description: Israeli President Isaac Herzog has visited Melbourne as part of his Australian tour. title: Multiple rescued after becoming stranded in Alice Springs flash floods | ABC NEWS
description: Northern Territory emergency services have rescued multiple people isolated by flash flooding in Alice Springs, with water levels now slowly receding.   Dangerous thunderstorms caused river levels to rise dramatically in the Central Australian town, cutting off several roads and all low-level causeways.   Emergency services issued an Emergency Warning early this morning, which has now been downgraded to a Watch and Act.  While river levels are slowly receding, authorities have warned floodwater is still flowing and may contain strong currents. Elsie Lange has this update for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Thousands gather in Melbourne to protest Israeli president | ABC NEWS
description: Protests have been held in Melbourne's CBD as Israeli president Isaac Herzog's visit to the city winds up.  The Israeli president said his tour of the country, which included a meeting with Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, in the wake of the Bondi terror attack had been "very emotional".  Mr Herzog has personally been criticised for his comments following the October 7 attacks, in which he said it was "not true" that civilians were not aware or involved in the attacks.  The UN inquiry found those comments "may reasonably be interpreted as incitement" of genocide, though they did not "expressly call for ... genocide".  Mr Herzog said his words were taken out of context, and that there was "no excuse for murdering innocent civilians". description: Wales is proposing a new law to make it illegal for politicians to lie during Welsh elections. Critics, however, say the law would limit free speech. title: Chaos and confusion after shock airspace closure in El Paso | The World | ABC NEWS
description: There's been travel chaos in the US border city of El Paso after authorities declared a snap ten-day closure of its airspace. The declaration was then lifted after just seven hours, with US officials blaming an alleged incursion by Mexican cartel drones. But as Rebecca Johnston reports, it's left many outraged and demanding answers. title: Madagascar devastated by powerful cyclone, dozens killed | The World | ABC NEWS
description: More than thirty people have been killed after a powerful cyclone ripped through parts of Madagascar's north-east. Cyclone Gezani weakened to a tropical storm after devastating the country's main port city. Caren Ramanantoanina from the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies gave The World's Girish Sawlani the latest update from Madagascar's capital. title: Polls close in Bangladesh's first election since leader ousted | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Polls have closed after Bangladeshi voters lined up to cast their ballots for the country's next prime minister. It's the first election since an uprising saw the ousting of long-time leader Sheikh Hasina in 2024 after anti-government protests turned deadly. Security was tight at thousands of polling places around the country, with more than 127 million people eligible to vote. ABC correspondent Allyson Horn was in Dhaka with the latest.
